title: Light monitor for plants tutorial
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to monitor the light reaching your plants.

Select **LightIntensity** to use your device's camera to measure the amount of light received.

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/LightIntensity-Item.png)

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Press devices again, select **Text2Speech**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/Text2Speech-Item.png)

to use the device as a text-to-speech player.

Press on your smartphone **Add device via QR code**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Add-device-via-qr-code.png)

and scan the QR code. Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Do the same for the **DataRecorder**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/DataRecorder-Item.png)

This will be used to store the captured light intensity in a .csv file.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/Logic.png) on the sidebar,

moves the following components to the workspace

the **if** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/if-component.png)

and the **comparison** component

![comparison](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/comparison-component.png)

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/Math.png) on the sidebar,

move the **number** component to the workspace

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/number-component.png)

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Timing/Timing.png) on the sidebar,

move the **delay** component to the workspace

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Timing/delay-component.png)

Moves the following components to the workspace

the **Intensity** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/intensity.png)


the **Text2Speech** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/text2speech.png)
and the **record-data** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/record-data.png)

Put the components of the previous steps as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/blocks.png)
The idea is that you put the smartphone where the plant is to measure the intensity of light that you want to reach it, and knowing that, you constantly evaluate the intensity of light that is reaching it and in case it is more than you want it to reach it, the smartphone alerts you through voice. In addition, the idea is to save the data of the intensity of light received to see at what times it gets more or less light.

To constantly monitor the amount of light that is reaching the plant, we will use the main loop component, which allows us to rerun the code after it has finished executing.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Loops/Loops.png) on the sidebar.

Then, move to the workspace the main loop component

![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Loops/main-loop-component.png)

and place it as shown in the picture

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/main-loop.png)
